heading: 1.1 Review of R basics
text:
R name programming language. RStudio name integrated development
environment (IDE). application running RStudio.already , R can downloaded .
RStudio (desktop version) can downloaded
. R installed 
installing RStudio.already R installed device, ensure version >= 4.0.0. Otherwise,
use links install latest version.

heading: 1.1.1 Configure RStudio settings
text:
settings can found Tools -> Global Options....Uncheck boxes modify dropdowns mention saving items upon exit restoring items
upon startup. ensure RStudio starts fresh session time.

heading: 1.1.2 Console pane
text:
RStudio application opened, Console pane occupy entirety left
side. (Open image new tab small)code typed Console evaluated immediately upon pressing Enter.
need evaluate multi-line code, Shift + Enter used 
create line breaks.

heading: 1.1.3 Source pane
text:
RStudio application opened, Source pane hidden default. Source
pane modify R scripts. strongly recommended save important
code (code may need revisit later date) inside R script file. new R script can
created using:File -> New File -> R Script, orCtrl + Shift + N, orClicking  selecting "R Script"Source pane appear top left open R script.
(Open image new tab small)Code typed script file evaluated upon pressing Enter. Code must 
sent Source Console evaluation.run single line code, place typing cursor anywhere line press
Ctrl + Enter.run multiple lines code, highlight desired lines press Ctrl +
Enter.run entire script start finish, click  .

heading: 1.1.4 Environment pane
text:
Environment pane top right pane RStudio. pane shows variables 
initialised current R session. variables current R session can removed
clicking broom icon. Alternatively, switching Grid view List view allow 
remove selected variables.

heading: 1.1.5 Comments
text: Comments can added R script prepending # symbol.

heading: 1.1.6 Variables
text:
Variables created using convention name <- value.variable successfully initialised, appear Environment pane. 
simple variables, value variable can seen Environment pane. variables
whose values visible Environment pane, values can checked calling
Console:using RStudio's built-viewer typing Console:

heading: 1.1.7 Vectors
text:
Vectors univariate data structures. Vectors can created using c() function 
elements separated commas.Note examplevar1 actually vector length 1.calling vectors Console, note numbers square brackets 
corresponding output represent position number first element line.elements vectors can extracted supplying vector positive integers inside square
brackets. Note R, indices begin 1.elements vectors can deleted supplying vector negative integers inside square
brackets. Note R, indices begin 1.

heading: 1.1.8 Data frames
text:
Data frames multivariate data structures. Data frames can thought vertical
concatentation vectors. cases, column data frame contains values 
single variable row data frame contains values variable single
observation. example, consider following data set:example , column contains values single variable row contains
values variable single observation (patient).Things note:Data frames can created supplying name-value pairs data.frame() function.Name-value pairs supplied using = rather <-.name-value pair must length. Missing values can represented using NA.
code:
patients <- data.frame(
  patient_id = c("123abc", "28fnr8", "02jr8d", "r82j45", "t90ro5"),
  height = c(181, 145, 190, 210, 94),
  mass = c(85, 72, 82, 90, 60),
  sex = c("M", "F", "M", "F", "F")
)

patients##   patient_id height mass sex
## 1     123abc    181   85   M
## 2     28fnr8    145   72   F
## 3     02jr8d    190   82   M
## 4     r82j45    210   90   F
## 5     t90ro5     94   60   F
